sections.heading: Short title.
sections.text:
This Act may be cited as the
National Forest Land Act.

sections.heading: Consent of the State of Illinois is given to the United
sections.text:
States for the acquisition by purchase, gift, or condemnation with
adequate compensation, of such lands in the State of Illinois as in the
opinion of the Federal Government may be needed for the establishment,
consolidation and extension of national forests in the State. The State
of Illinois retains concurrent jurisdiction with the United States over
such areas in the matter of the service thereon of all civil and
criminal process issuing under the authority of the State of Illinois.

sections.heading: Eminent domain. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, any power granted under this Act to acquire property by condemnation or eminent domain is subject to, and shall be exercised in accordance with, the Eminent Domain Act
sections.text: Eminent domain. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, any power granted under this Act to acquire property by condemnation or eminent domain is subject to, and shall be exercised in accordance with, the Eminent Domain Act.
